DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate whether the treatment of acute neurodermitis with silver-contained textiles is equivalent or more effective to the conservative exogenous treatment with a corticosteroid. Secondary aim is to define skin comfortability of the textiles.
DOC.brief_title: Study About Effectiveness of Silver-Containing Textiles for Treatment of Acute Neurodermatitis
DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis of acute Neurodermitis Age: 270 years Patients are mobile Patient's information and willingness to participate Acute viral infection (herpes zoster, eczema herpeticum) Acute staphylodermas Other skindiseases affecting outcomes of intervention (e.g. psoriasis) Current UVTreatment Current other immunosuppressive or immunomodulated Therapy Current antimicrobial Therapy (e.g. antibiotics) Severe general diseases (e.g. melanoma, renal insufficiency, autoimmune diseases) Pregnancy Fertile females without effective contraception
